memory_dumps_classification.linux_x64_meterpreter_reverse_tcp_staged: Linux Meterpreter Staged TCP Reverse Shell
memory_dumps_classification.linux_x64_meterpreter_bind_tcp_staged.vm: Linux Meterpreter Staged TCP Bind Shell
memory_dumps_classification.linux_x64_meterpreter_reverse_tcp_stagel: Linux Meterpreter Stageless TCP Reverse Shell
memory_dumps_classification.process_injection_reverse_tcp.raw: Windows Meterpreter TCP Reverse Shell with Process Injection

RemoteShellRecommendations: Isolate the affected system from the network immediately to prevent further unauthorized access.
Conduct a thorough investigation to identify the source of the reverse or bind shell and any other potential compromises.
Remove any malicious software or backdoors that may have been installed on the system.
Change all passwords and credentials that may have been exposed during the compromise.
Implement network monitoring to detect any unusual outbound connections in the future.
Block known malicious IP addresses and domains at the firewall level to prevent future connections.
